sentences.english: Are you jealous of your classmates' success?
sentences.chinese: 你嫉妒旧日同窗的成功吗？

sentences.english: Scott and Paul are rooates and also classmates at Chengchi University.

sentences.english: He lost sight of his school friends over the years.
sentences.chinese: 这些年来他和同窗好友失去了联系。

sentences.english: Be expert in human communication , have higher prestige in the schoolmate.

sentences.chinese: 李明或者是他的同班同窗在扫除房间。

sentences.english: Friendship born out of several years' study in the same classroom leaves everlasting warmth in our deep hearts.
sentences.chinese: 同窗数载的深厚情谊，在你我心中留下了永驻的温馨。

sentences.english: Original, bai Ying and Shi Yueer are in abroad is schoolfellow.
sentences.chinese: 原来，白鹰与史月儿在国外是同窗。

sentences.english: Years senior middle school schoolmate , I comprehend to your this deputy class monitor very much .
sentences.chinese: 两年的高中同窗，我对你这个副班长还是很了解的。

sentences.english: To have a school-fellow coming from far away, isn't that also a delight?
sentences.chinese: 有同窗好友从远方来，不也令人高兴吗？

sentences.english: Initially known as the Xiaonei network, it is designed to help people find old classmates.
sentences.chinese: 原名校内网，该网站帮助人们寻找旧时同窗。

sentences.english: Even though I hdewoulsn't seen my clbummmdined for many years- I recognized him immedidinedly.
sentences.chinese: 纵然多年没有看见我的同窗，我也立地认出了他。

sentences.english: You may twisk to someone to stor higher together with answer your questions.
sentences.chinese: 你可以叫一位同窗起来答复你的问题。

sentences.english: His schoolmates took him to be a country bumpkin. In fact, he's from an influential family.
sentences.chinese: 他的同窗把他当成乡巴佬，其实他的家庭很有背景。

sentences.english: Mark Madoff was remembered fondly by former classmates Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一马克的昔日同窗对他进行了追思。

sentences.english: JiXin received old classmate party invitation, the condition is necessary to bring dependents.
sentences.chinese: 齐欣接到老同窗聚会的约请，条件是必需要带家眷。

definition: friend from whom you can seek advice
to be in the same class/to be in the same squad/classmate
person from the same village, town, or province
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
